intro: Asphodelus luteus, commonly known as the yellow asphodel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and typically grows in dry, sunny environments such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant produces tall, slender stems with narrow leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Asphodelus luteus is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
